content: pokeball to dragonite reversible pattern by the nerd gremlin pokeball to dragonite reversible pattern by the nerd gremlin materials hooks for majority of pattern 3 25 mm/us d/3 for chain stitches at opening 4 00 mm/us g/6 yarn worsted weight yarn i use caron simply soft pokeball colors - red caron harvest red black caron black white caron white dragonite colors - yellow caron gold off-white i would describe it as cream colored caron off white dark teal caron pagoda tan caron bone white caron white small amount of dark green caron dark sage small amount of black caron black yardage the finished piece weighs 106 grams there is a small amount of stuffing but i estimate that is 188 yards of yarn but i do not know how much for each color small amount of fiberfill stuffing do not over stuff sewing notions tapestry needle sewing needle black and yellow 6 in 15 24 cm zippers 7 sewing pins to help hold zipper on the pokeball while you sew sewing thread in red white yellow and white for shaping the horns pattern i have a video showing how to crochet the pokeball https //www tiktok com/t/ztl87ctaq/ notes warning this pattern is not beginner friendly in particular there are many color changes and some non-standard shaping in the pokemon body if you are struggling don t be afraid to reach out to me the nerd gremlin on tiktok and instagram i am human and it s possible i made a mistake or need to rewrite something so it s clearer i have gotten multiple comments telling me to charge for my patterns but i am just a hobbyist not a business and you can probably tell that from the format of my pattern i welcome feedback to improve my work if you would have bought this pattern i pokeball to dragonite reversible pattern by the nerd gremlin encourage you to instead donate to your local public broadcasting station pbs enrich the world through supporting the spread and availability of knowledge and ideas as they say i just want to watch the world learn when working in the round i work in a spiral rather than chaining 1 at the end of all my rounds it s just easier for me when changing colors you can often use the easy common method of carrying the other yarn under the stitches and pulling up the next color as the last step when finishing the previous stitch when you need a new color row like when you change colors in the pokeball use a method that minimizes visual disjointenness the row not connecting because working in a spiral i like this method https //www tiktok com/t/ztl8wmaem/ but make sure you are maintaining 42 stitches when you use it finish off usually means to chain 1 and pull a tail though if you are working a circle you can slip_stitch in the next stitch and then chain 1 and pull through the tail to
